result.execSummary:
The defendant William Eskridge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments and costs.  To be paid through collection of sums by DOC from 25% of prison funds and as a condition of Extended supervision.  Any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain AODA assessment.  Complete follow up care/treatment.   Absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample, pay surcharge.
Defendant informed he may not possess and/or own any firearms; and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been reinstated.

records.addlTxt: Filed, signed Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment.  The Court Orders the petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. M. Joseph Donald, Br. 2, for review. spc

Defendant William Eskridge in court with Attorney Chelsea Williamson.  Defendant William Eskridge in custody.  
Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

**CASE HEARD BY BRANCH 02 FOR BRANCH 35**

Matter before the Court for Jury Trial.  Defense no longer in a contest posture; plea forms submitted.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

COUNT 1:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Element Sheet received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  

COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on state's motion the Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED AND READ-IN for the purpose of sentencing in Count 1.


Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, defense, and defendant. 
 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 54 MONTHS with credit for 162 days. 

The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS.  

The MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION IS 36 MONTHS.

The defendant IS ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
*Obtain AODA assessment and complete follow-up care/treatment;
*Absolute sobriety- submit to random urine screens;
*Provide DNA sample- pay surcharge;
*Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments, and costs;

The Court ordered all financial obligations to be paid through collection of sums by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.

Defendant is informed he may not possess and/or own any firearms.
Defendant is informed he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been reinstated.  
Defendant advised of right to appeal this sentence.  Defendant REMANDED into custody to start serving sentence forthwith.
Filed;
-Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
-Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence- copy.
Due to Judge Rosa's congested calendar, matter spun to Judge Donald for plea and sentencing.

Attorney Chelsea Williamson in court, defendant William Eskridge not in court, in custody.  Antonella Aleman for Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court holds conference with counsel in chambers off the record. Matter is called on the record. Court orders trial motions and witness lists to be filed by 10/16/15. Matter remains in trial posture, trial remains scheduled for jury trial on 10/21/15 at 9:30am in br. 35.

Attorney Chelsea Williamson in court, defendant William Eskridge not in court, in custody.  
Hanna Ritchie Kolberg for Nathaniel Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the court for Status conference.  Defense in contest posture; jury trial reqeusted.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Frederick Rosa, Branch 35, in Room 629 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Chelsea Williamson in court, defendant William Eskridge not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Status conference scheduled for 07-27-2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant William Eskridge in court with attorney Chelsea Williamson.  Defendant William Eskridge in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: City of Milwaukee Police Department Officer Sean Mahnke.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #13CF4546 that are attached to the complaint. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant William Eskridge in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant William Eskridge in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
